title: Deploy OO Containerized capability in Suite Administration
content:
The suite admin needs to deploy the Operations Orchestration (OO) capability on a tenant in Suite Administration before the tenant admin can integrate their SMAX system with Operations Orchestration Containerized or integrate it with Design and Deploy (DND). 

Prerequisite

Before deploying the OO capability in Suite Administration, complete the following prerequisites

  1. Make sure that the tenant admin user already exists in the agent interface. If the tenant admin has never logged in to the agent interface, ask the tenant admin to log in to the agent interface. This is because the system will need to replicate the relationship between the tenant admin user and the OO Administrators group from IdM to the agent interface, and so you need to make sure that the tenant admin user already exists in the agent interface. 
  2. Import the OO certificate into the suite. For helm deployment, see Import OO certificate to the Suite to complete this step. For classic deployment, see Import OO CA certificate into the suite.

Deploy the OO capability

  1. Log in to Suite Administration as suite-admin: https://<SMA_Hostname>/bo.
  2. Click Tenants and then open the tenant.
  3. Select the Capability settings tab, and then click Deploy new capability.
  4. In the Capability field, select Operations Orchestration. 
  5. Enter the OO integration URL and OO login URL.
    Deployment platform OO login URL OO integration URL
    On-premises

    This URL is in this format:  https://<OO_HOST>:<OO_PORT>. 

    You can obtain the host name and port information from the OO values.yaml file used during OO installation, at helm parameters externalAccessHost and externalAccessPort. 

    Example: https://myoohost.example.com:9443

    Same as the OO login URL. 
    AWS with EKS The URL of the OO public load balancer in the format https://<OO_public_load_balancer_fqdn>:<OO_public_load_balancer_port>. See Configure load balancers for OO. The URL of the OO internal load balancer in the format https://<OO_internal_load_balancer_fqdn>:<OO_internal_load_balancer_port>. 
    Azure with AKS

    This URL is in this format: https://<OO_HOST>:<OO_PORT>. 

    You can obtain the host name and port information from the OO values.yaml file used during the OO installation, at helm parameters global.externalAccessHost and global.externalAccessPort.

    Example: oo.smax.example.com:443.

    		 Same as the OO login URL.
  6. Click Next. The system starts the validation of the URLs you entered:
    The URLs must start with https or http and mustn't contain a trailing slash (/).
    The system can connect to the OO controller in the backend by using the OO integration URL you entered. 
  7. If the URLs have passed the validation, a note appears below the URLs, indicating that it's impossible to remove the OO capability once deployed. Select the checkbox for the note and then click Deploy. 
  8. The deployment starts. You can check the deployment progress on the Operation history tab of the tenant. Click Close to close the window. 
  9. Wait several minutes until the deployment is Done. 
  10. Set the Enable capability toggle button to On.
  11. Click Save.

    If the OO integration URL is invalid, an error occurs. Normally, this won't happen unless you have changed this URL by mistake after the previous URL validation in step 6. In this case, correct the wrong URL and then click Test Connection to validate this URL again and then click Save.

Verify the OO roles and groups in the agent interface

To make sure that you have successfully enabled the OO capability, you need to verify that the system has replicated the seeded OO roles and groups from IdM to the agent interface. 

  1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin. 
  2. Navigate to Administration > People > Roles, and check that the following roles are available: 
    [OO] OO ADMINISTRATOR
    [OO] OO CONTENT ADMINISTRATOR
    [OO] OO END USER
    [OO] OO POWER USER
    [OO] OO SCHEDULE OPERATOR
    [OO] OO WORKFLOW OPERATOR
  3. Navigate to Administration > People > Groups, and check that the following groups are available: 
    OO ADMINISTRATORS
    OO CONTENT ADMINISTRATORS
    OO END USERS
    OO POWER USERS
    OO SCHEDULE OPERATORS
    OO WORKFLOW OPERATORS
  4. Open the OO ADMINISTRATORS group record, and check that the tenant admin user is assigned to this group.
